blockdesc-compostbin-*-*: Add vegetation and rot to create compost over time.
compostingredux:pile-needs-settle: The pile needs to settle. Wait {0} more hours.
compostingredux:handbook-howto-text:
Add compostable organic materials to the bin. Materials are classified as greens (nitrogen-rich) or browns (carbon-rich). The ratio between these materials affects decomposition speed.

Use a shovel on the pile to turn it, providing aeration and speeding up the process. Harvest finished compost by right-clicking with an empty hand.
compostingredux:handbook-tips-text:
Greens (C:N ratio 15:1): Vegetables, fruit, rot
Browns (C:N ratio 60:1): Grain

The bin calculates a weighted average C:N ratio based on the materials added. A ratio of 25-30:1 is optimal for fastest decomposition (1.5x speed). Ratios below 20:1 or above 40:1 will slow decomposition to 0.5x speed.

A mix of approximately 2 greens to 1 brown achieves optimal ratios. Hover over the bin to view current material counts, C:N ratio, and decomposition speed.
compostingredux:handbook-ratio-text:
The C:N ratio determines decomposition rate. Each material contributes its C:N value weighted by quantity.

Examples:
10 greens = 15:1 ratio (0.5x speed)
10 browns = 60:1 ratio (0.5x speed)
10 greens + 5 browns = 30:1 ratio (1.5x speed)
6 greens + 9 browns = 42:1 ratio (0.7x speed)

Speed multipliers by ratio:
15-20:1 = 0.5x (too much nitrogen)
25-30:1 = 1.5x (optimal)
35-40:1 = 1.0x (acceptable)
45+:1 = 0.5x (too much carbon)
compostingredux:compostbin-tooltip-moist: Too dry - add water or wait for rain
Too wet - add dry browns or turn pile
compostingredux:compostbin-tooltip-aerat: Anaerobic - turn pile to add oxygen!
